Posts.Content: Ugh! My tastebuds have all switched off today - even Marmite tastes bland!
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: I didn’t get hiccups but did get trapped wind - lansoprazole helped me too. I’m 14 days in - scalp has gone tender and I think my hair is starting to depart. Very dry skin on hands so have invested in some Eucerin (thank goodness for this forum where I find out all the top tips!). Onward and upward!
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Morning all I’m in until mid-March assuming all goes to plan... just completed my first EC cycle, which wasn’t nearly as bad as I feared, although I had pain around my surgery site. Mostly managed okay with paracetamol. Coming off steroids after day 3 did ‘crash’ me a bit, and I’ve had some indigestion/constipation but seem to be on the mend today. My hair is still there, for a few days at least! Next dose is 20/12 so am hoping for similar so that we can have a decent Christmas Day, then one in January and onto 3 lots of docetaxel.  I’ve got bisphosphonates every other dose and then radiotherapy and ten years of hormones to look forward to, all seems a bit daunting but needs must!
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Hit for six - I’ve got my next EC on the 20th so I think ice lollies will be the order of the day for Christmas!
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: I was told it was a known side effect of the EC, particularly the E... pink wee and a red face. I was very red across face and chest for a few days.
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Hi all I’ve been reading with interest- I have my second EC tomorrow. I've had no problems with veins from round one, but as I’ve already had surgery (mastectomy and full ANC) and have cording around my lymph vessels on my right side, there is only my left to use for the injections. My oncologist was very decisive at my first appointment with her that if I had any vein problems she would immediately go for a PICC line, to limit any cording on my ‘good’ side. I hope I won’t need that, but it’s good to know it’s an option. Fingers crossed that round 2 is as straightforward as round 1 - apart from the constipation I had very few SEs. Best of luck and good wishes to everyone xxx
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: I’m nowhere near this point yet ( still having chemo)  but am following with interest - the idea of making something new and beautiful appeals to me too. best of luck!
